name: Rivers & People: A Disconnect in Times of Scarcity ~ by Paani.Earth
description:
Rivers & People: A Disconnect in Times of Scarcity
Creating a Space to Think, Ideate and Protect Rivers
Bengaluru, India’s economic engine, is a water-starved city. The Cauvery river, its lifeline, is drying up and severely polluted, while the Western Ghats forests, where its waters originate, are rapidly degrading. Yet, the government continues to push for unsound projects like the Mekedatu Dam and Yettinahole Drinking Water project, further damaging the rivers and forests that sustain us. Amid this, the city remains disconnected from its rivers, yet perpetually thirsty. 
This session will begin with a discussion followed by songs about rivers sung by children and an English adaptation of Komal Swaminathan’s 1980 satirical Tamil play Thaneer Thaneer. Set in a drought-ridden village in Tamil Nadu, the play follows a stranger who helps the villagers harness water against political and natural challenges, showing the power of a community deeply connected to its water sources. 
It promises to be a valuable experience for anyone who cares about the environment, our rivers, and the future we are shaping for generations to come. 
RSVP Here 
Paani.Earth, a citizen-led think tank, is dedicated to river conservation. The team will share their efforts to protect the rivers that sustain us. Through this session, they aim to foster a deep understanding and compassion for rivers — crucial for meaningful change. 
Speakers and Performers 





Nidhi Paliwal- Curator & Researcher, Paani.Earth
Nirmala Gowda – Curator & Researcher, Paani.Earth
Madhuri Mandava – Curator & Researcher, Paani.Earth
Khushbu K Birawat – Curator & Researcher, Paani.Earth
GoodEarth Malhar Community Theatre Group

location.name: Bangalore International Centre, 7, 4th Main Rd, Stage 2, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071

name: The What, How and Why of Lake Restoration ~ Azim Premji University
description:
Enough has been written and described about Bengaluru being the city of lakes and tanks. However, many of these public spaces continue to be in disrepair despite the tremendous amount of work undertaken towards restoring lakes, highlighting the need for more sustained efforts in this direction. Numerous initiatives have focussed on protecting Bengaluru’s lakes, but these initiatives are often confronted with a lack of resources, limited understanding of management policies, and inadequate ecological considerations of outcomes. 
As part of their initiatives on climate change and sustainability, Azim Premji University is organising a one-day workshop on understanding the processes involved in lake restoration. We aim to provide a platform for communities to come together and learn about the importance of lake restoration, and understand how to engage in restoration efforts. 
Engage in meaningful discussion and dialogue around lake restoration processes, and learn from the experiences of communities that have succeeded in similar efforts. The workshop will include citizen groups, ecologists, researchers and practitioners experienced in the area of restoration of lakes. 
The workshop will highlight the role of citizens and communities, the collaboration of stakeholders including governments, resident associations, civil society groups, and donors, and will detail the various steps in lake restoration, through conversations with experts involved in this journey for decades. In addition, the workshop will underline the need for effective communication and dissemination to garner public support. 
Register Now

location.name: Bangalore International Centre, 7, 4th Main Rd, Stage 2, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071

name: eARTh Event 2nd edition ~ by CSTEP
description:
The second edition of the eARTh Event will be conducted on 20 September 2024 at the Bangalore International Centre, Karnataka. 
The eARTh Initiative, launched by CSTEP in 2023, has played a key role in integrating art into the core of climate action. It provides a platform for scientists, artists, conservationists, and citizens to collaborate on exploring how art and science can work together to bring about positive change for the planet. 
This year, the eARTh Event will showcase artwork from the eARTh Climate Fellows, created during their nine-month-long climate fellowship at CSTEP. The event will also see the launch of Arth, CSTEP’s coffee-table book on art and artists. Young under-resourced students associated with Slam Out Loud will perform poetry, and the audience will get an opportunity to participate in a live poetry workshop. Another highlight of the event will be the performance by the Vasu Dixit Collective. 
Event Agenda

name: Back to Roots Residency ~ by Spudnik Farms
description:
Back to Roots is a residency program by Spudnik Farms aimed at creating spaces for interdisciplinary learning and fostering cultural exchanges that stimulate food innovation necessary for healthier and more prosperous communities. The goal is to unite the culinary expertise of chefs with the profound insights of local farmers, pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in the world of food. 
Spudnik Farms, +91 7349632966 +91 9900606698 
Residency Activities:  

Field trips and excursions to tuber-growing communities
Hands-on experience with tuber crop cultivation and harvesting
Workshops and talks by experts on tuber crops and sustainable agriculture
Collaborative recipe development and cooking sessions
Cultural exchanges and community engagement activities

Submission Instructions: 

Please submit your completed application form, along with any supporting materials (portfolio, website links, etc.) by 30th August 2024.
Selected participants will be notified by the end of September.

name: 2-day exhibition at Rangoli Metro Art Centre ~ Azim Premji University
description:
With the planet in turmoil and climate crisis spilling into and affecting our daily lives, a coming together of global citizens is needed to address the human impact on nature. 
This 2 day exhibition will offer a glimpse of the climate festival of Azim Premji University, that has explored the distant rivers of life and ancient forests over the last two years. It will include: 

Selected photo-essay stories and maps on rivers and forests
Artefacts and mountain art installations
Movie screenings

REGISTER NOW

location.name: Rangoli Metro Art Centre, MG Road, Bengaluru

name: "Children Need Nature" - a national conference ~ by Karma Bhoomi Trust
description:
The Children need Nature conference is being offered to all by Prakriya Green Wisdom School and Bhoomi College with Karma Bhoomi Trust as the organiser. 
About the Conference: Many thought leaders and educationists would agree that all of us, children as well as adults will benefit from connecting to Nature, living a lifestyle that values Nature more. In addition, today there is increasing scientific research as well, that makes it clear that children need Nature for multiple reasons, not only for their physical and mental health, but also to improve their cognitive and creative abilities as well as their socio-emotional and personal growth. It is also becoming increasingly clear that it is essential to foster future generations who have a greater connect with Nature and a greater willingness to engage in climate action and practices for sustainability. What the world needs more than ever before are custodians and stewards of nature! It has become an imperative in times of acute climate crisis and nature disconnect. 
The purpose of this conference is to create a space for parents, educators and school administrators to share research findings and nature education practices and join a movement to include Nature education sessions in schools to care for the future of our children and the future of our planet. The organisers welcome you to be part of the conference! 
REGISTER NOW

location.name: NIMHANS Convention Centre, Hosur Road, Bengaluru-560029

name: International Conference on Nurturing Sustainability through Innovations in Science and Technology for Global Welfare
description:
JAIN (Deemed-to-be University) provides a significant platform for scholars and professionals to foster creative thinking and address global challenges. In line with this commitment, we are orchestrating a two-day conference, ICONS 2024, focusing on science, technology, and sustainability. Our objective is to unite scholars and technologists in a collaborative environment to promote dialogue and action aligned with the Sustainable Development Goals outlined by the United Nations. Additionally, recognizing the UN’s designation of the “Year of Camelids,” our conference acknowledges and celebrates the economic and nutritional significance of members of Camelidae. Through keynote addresses, panel discussions, and exhibitions, we aim to convene distinguished figures in science, healthcare and environment. ICONS 2024 endeavors to provide a platform for scholars and industrialists to showcase innovative solutions and facilitate knowledge exchange, potentially leading to impactful collaborations and advancements in various fields. 
REGISTER NOW

location.name: School of Science, JAIN (Deemed-to-be University) #34, 1st Cross, behind Ravindra Kalakshetra, JC Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560027
